instruction:
You will be asked to answer the following question as part of the LinkedIn Skill assessments.

You find that your project has a tag and branch both named push-notifications, which causes confusion when trying to print out given reference. How can you specify which branch you want to look at?
output:
To specify which branch you want to look at, you can use the --branch option when running the command. For example, if you want to look at the tag branch, you can run the command:

git show --branch push-notifications

If you want to look at the branch, you can run the command:

git show push-notifications

This will display the commit history for the specified branch.
